Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored an early goal
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in the 53rd minute
Cristiano Ronaldo was booked in the first half
Ronaldo was substituted after the break
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia, ranked 74th in FIFA rankings, defeated Portugal, ranked 6th in the world
Georgia's win is the biggest upset by FIFA rankings in European Championship history
Georgia qualified through UEFA Nations League and playoffs
Georgia's coach Willy Sagnol expressed pride in the team's achievement
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia's goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili made late saves to keep Portugal at bay
Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo cut a frustrated figure when he was substituted
Georgia's win means they will face Spain in the round of 16
Georgia's win also means that England will play Slovakia, Romania will take on the Netherlands, and Portugal will face Slovenia in the round of 16
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia's win is the greatest result for Georgia since gaining independence in 1991
Portugal played a largely second-string team
Georgia came close to snatching a draw with Turkey but lost 3-1 in their opening game
Georgia missed a great chance to beat Czechia in a 1-1 draw
